com.twitter.common.application
Class AppLauncher

java.lang.Object
  com.twitter.common.application.AppLauncher

public final class AppLauncher
extends java.lang.Object

An application launcher that sets up a framework for pluggable binding modules. This class should be called directly as the main class, with a command line argument -app_class which is the canonical class name of the application to execute. If your application uses command line arguments (Arg} annotated with CmdLine, you should specify -arg_scan_packages to indicate which java packages should be recursively scanned for arguments to parse, validate, and apply. A bootstrap module will be automatically applied (AppLauncherModule), which provides overridable default bindings for things like quit/abort hooks and a health check function. A LifecycleModule is also automatically applied to perform startup and shutdown actions.
